revised_title: Computer-Controlled Learning in Insects: A Model System for Cellular Neuronal Events
tldr: The authors developed computer programs for on-line control of training in an insect preparation, allowing them to study cellular neuronal events underlying learning. They demonstrated that locusts could learn to change the frequency of discharge of a tonic motoneurone, showing that plasticity of tonic motoneurones may be a widespread phenomenon. This preparation can serve as a model system for cellular learning studies, with both up-learning and down-learning occurring and being reversible.
